span.a: Tweets by Tallmadge City School District

div.span: 3-30-20 6:00PM **COVID-19 Update**Good evening.This is Superintendent Jeff Ferguson of the Tallmadge City Schools calling with an important update. Today, Governor Mike DeWine extended his closure of our school buildings and facilities until Friday, May 1st with a potential return date of Monday, May 4th. He continues to caution us in these unprecedented times that we should plan to potentially be closed for the remainder of the school year. We will continue to plan for the worst but hope for the best.

h3.a: Tallmadge native’s search for adventure leads to Navy

div.span: Four years ago, Petty Officer 3rd Class Madison Stock joined the Navy because she was looking for other adventures outside her hometown of Tallmadge. Today, Stock is serving aboard USS Boxer, stationed in San Diego

h3.a: TALLMADGE SCHOOLS ANNOUNCES CRITICAL CHANGES TO BUS TIMES/ROUTES WITH OPENING OF NEW ELEMENTARY

div.span: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE TALLMADGE, OH (February 11, 2020) – Tallmadge City Schools is set to open its new Tallmadge Elementary School on Monday, March 30, 2020. Tallmadge Elementary will consolidate Dunbar Primary and Munroe Elementary into one building, bringing together kindergarten through fifth-grade. With the opening of the new school, new bus routes and pick-up/drop-off times for kindergarten through fifth-grade students have been established.

h3.a: Tallmadge High School Awarded the Purple Star by Ohio Department of Education.

div.span: The Purple Star designation recognizes schools that meet important criteria for serving military-connected students and families...

h3.a: Travel with Madame Metzger to Spain and France in June 2022!

div.span: Travel with Madame Metzger to Spain and France in June 2022!All students of 14 or older at time of trip are invited to join us!Parents or other family members (14 or older) encouraged to join us too! For more information and how to enroll, go to:https://www.educationaltravel.com/registerTrip ID: Metzger-2022Contact Madame Metzger with questions: metzger.julie@tallmadgeschools.org
Click here to the view the Bus Routes and Times for all buildings.

div.p: This is Superintendent Jeff Ferguson of the Tallmadge City Schools calling with an important update. Today, Governor Mike DeWine extended his closure of our school buildings and facilities until Friday, May 1st with a potential return date of Monday, May 4th. He continues to caution us in these unprecedented times that we should plan to potentially be closed for the remainder of the school year. We will continue to plan for the worst but hope for the best.

Today started your students’ remote learning. It is crucial we hear from you during these early days to make sure it is going well for your student. We are in this together, we will continue to meet your students’ needs to the best of our ability. Our teachers have given you their contact information and, although our buildings are closed, we continue to answer all building phones. Our website continues to have all the latest information available.
We are here for you and remain committed to your child’s education and well-being. Stay safe, stay home and THANK YOU for your increased role that you are currently playing in your child’s education.
Have a great night and stay safe.

Superintendent
Tallmadge City Schools
Jeff Ferguson
